p: Depicted IC 50 values of BvLM (0.0519 ± 1.02 μg/mL) and BvRM (2.668 ± 0.49 μg/mL) illustrated BvLM as stronger radical scavenger than BvRM. BvLM (IC 50: 0.0519 ± 1.02 μg/mL) was found to be more significant than the standard Gallic acid (IC 50: 1.367 ± 0.1 μg/mL) ( Fig. 4b). The scavenging activity for H 2O 2 of plant extracts is given in the following order BvLM > BvRM (0.0519 ± 1.02 > 2.668 ± 0.49 μg/mL).
